summary.snippet: "Place was very clean, staff friendly and the meals reasonably priced."
"The food was tasty 😋 and I was SHOCKED ⚡ with the prices."
"Nice atmosphere and people but my beef dish was very overcooked and dry."

most_relevant.description: My oh my! Was very pleased with my Culantro experience. The food was tasty 😋 and I was SHOCKED ⚡ with the prices. They are VERY reasonable, and in fact, kinda cheap for AA standards! Both the chicken 🐔 and rice 🍚 were flavorful and well-seasoned. The trendy decor, brilliant lighting 💡, and Peruvian-themed interior were only added bonuses! Hope to return in the future!!

We had the Salchipulpos, the empanadas, Patacones Picantes, and the Chica Morada. The Salchipulpos and the Patacones were amazing, and the Chica Morada was a delicious refresher. Ultimately, it was tasty and very filling. The empanadas were good, healthy tasting.

What a good find. Love Peruvian chicken, its so well seasoned. We got a half chicken and lomo salteado. With rice beans and yuca frita. We started with chicken empanadas. The sauces are so good and spicy. I wish this place served a wine or beer. Love Culantro. Try it!!!

I’ve lived in Ann Arbor for 3 years and eaten at maybe 40-50 restaurants here. I think this is easily the best restaurant in Ann Arbor. I ordered the chicken (pollo a la braso), and it was seasoned and cooked perfectly. The rice was also fluffy and well-seasoned. Their service was friendly and accommodating as well. I ordered it another day for delivery and it was still great. I can’t stop thinking about this chicken. If their other dishes are this high quality then this restaurant deserves a Michelin star.

Culantro was an amazing stop for dinner! Highly recommended if you’re in the area.  The wait time to order, get seated, and receive my food was timely and the food was super tasty. Pictured below is the 1/4 lb Pan con Pollo with a side side, black beans, and a plate of Fritas.

1st Experience at Culantro: 5 Star Recommended.

I had a delightful exploration of Peruvian flavors in Culantro.
From spicy appetizers to rich, comforting entrees and innovative vegan options, each dish was a testament to the restaurant's commitment to flavor and quality.

Appetizer Delight:
-Patacones Picantes
Starting off with Patacones Picantes, the crispy deep-fried banana plantains topped with spicy aji verde and pico de gallo were a vibrant introduction to the meal, offering a delightful mix of sour and spicy notes.

Main Courses to Remember

-Pan Con Pollo
The marinated and roasted chicken sandwich, enhanced with salsa criolla and served with fries, was a comforting blend of flavors, demonstrating the magic of simple, well-executed dishes.

-Carne a La Plancha
This dish featured a well-done steak topped with an egg and served with an array of sides, including the standout chimichurri sauce that added a fresh, herby dimension to the meal.

-Tallarin Verde Vegan
A testament to the restaurant's versatility, this vegan spaghetti tossed in a rich, flavorful sauce with sautéed veggies and portobello mushrooms proved that plant-based dishes could dazzle the palate just as much as any meat dish.

Worth the wait!
Everything we had was amazing. Delicious, unique, and fresh. Esp recommend the Culantro Bowl if you are looking for bold vibrant flavors and the Aji de Gallina if you want something savory and comforting. Both juices we had were also delicious and refreshing. The whole time we were there it was packed with a line to the door and I can see why. 5 stars

Good food but a little lackluster. If you get the Pan con Pollo ask for extra sauce because it was dry. The Lomo Saltado was too salty LOL. Portion sizes are also pretty small. The actual restaurant is really small and it’s order at the booth and they don’t really have a system so when you walk in make sure to snag a table and then go order.
